title: Bill of Rights Amendments
description: Flashcards for each of the amendments in the Bill of Rights

back.heading: Freedom of Expression
back.description: Protects the freedom of speech, religion, press, assembly, and the right to petition the government for a redress of grievances.

back.heading: Right to Bear Arms
back.description: Protects the right of the people to keep and bear arms.

back.heading: Protection from Quartering
back.description: Prohibits the forced quartering of soldiers in private homes during peacetime without the owner's consent.

back.heading: Protection from Unreasonable Searches and Seizures
back.description: Protects against unreasonable searches and seizures and requires a judicially sanctioned warrant supported by probable cause for such actions.

back.heading: Rights of the Accused
back.description: Protects individuals from being compelled to be witnesses against themselves in criminal cases and prohibits double jeopardy and deprivation of life, liberty, or property without due process of law.

back.heading: Right to a Fair Trial
back.description: Guarantees the right to a fair and speedy public trial by an impartial jury, including the right to be informed of the nature and cause of the accusation, to confront witnesses, and to have the assistance of counsel.

back.heading: Trial by Jury in Civil Cases
back.description: Provides for the right to trial by jury in certain civil cases, according to the rules of common law.

back.heading: Protection from Cruel and Unusual Punishment
back.description: Prohibits the imposition of excessive bail or fines and cruel and unusual punishments.

back.heading: Unenumerated Rights
back.description: Affirms that the listing of individual rights in the Constitution and Bill of Rights does not deny or disparage other rights retained by the people.

back.heading: States' Rights
back.description: Reserves powers not delegated to the federal government to the states or the people.
